title: ‘Break her legs’: Pragya Thakur tells parents to punish daughters for meeting ‘non-Hindus’
description: Former Bhopal MP Pragya Singh Thakur has sparked controversy with remarks advising parents to physically punish daughters who visit non-Hindu homes, even suggesting "breaking their legs." Speaking at a religious event, Thakur urged parents to enforce obedience and values, stating that punishment is necessary for their well-being.

title: Items unverified for 40 yrs: Ivory, gold & valuables ‘missing’ from Guruvayur temple; key findings
description: Audits reveal alarming lapses in Guruvayur Devaswom's management of temple valuables, including gold, silver, and ivory. Poor recordkeeping and missing documentation have left precious assets vulnerable to misuse. Despite legal requirements, physical verification of valuables has been neglected for decades, raising concerns about accountability and potential misappropriation.

title: Diwali bonus row causes chaos on Agra-Lucknow Expressway; toll gates flung open
description: Toll gates on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway were opened by protesting workers demanding a higher Diwali bonus, causing thousands of vehicles to pass without payment. Police intervened, leading to discussions where the company agreed to a 10% salary hike, restoring operations after a two-hour disruption.

title: Punjab shocker: Ex-DGP, wife booked over son’s suspicious death; video sparks probe
description: Former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa and his wife, ex-minister Razia Sultana, are among four booked by Haryana Police in connection with their son Akil Akhter's death. Akhter was found dead under suspicious circumstances, with social media posts alleging threats to his life. A Special Investigation Team has been formed to probe the matter.

title: 'Clear evidence attack was by Pakistan': ACB spokesperson on airstrike in Paktika
description: Afghanistan's cricket board has pulled out of a tri-series in Pakistan after accusing Islamabad of an airstrike that killed three Afghan cricketers.  The ACB spokesperson demanded global condemnation, citing evidence of Pakistani involvement.  National players reportedly support the withdrawal, with Zimbabwe replacing Afghanistan in the tournament.

title: Economic warning: JPMorgan CEO urges action; Says US too dependent on unreliable sources
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is launching a $1.5 trillion, decade-long plan to bolster America's industrial strength and reduce foreign supply chain reliance.  The Security and Resiliency Initiative will target defense, frontier tech, energy, and advanced manufacturing, with the bank committing $10 billion to kickstart these vital sectors. Dimon urges immediate, unified action to secure the nation's future.

title: Sarfaraz misses out; Pant recovers to be named captain of India A vs South Africa A - complete squads
description: Rishabh Pant will lead the India A squad in two four-day matches against South Africa A. This marks Pant's return after recovering from a toe injury sustained in England. He was previously named in the Delhi Ranji Trophy squad but may miss that fixture. The matches are scheduled for October 30 and November 6 in Bengaluru.

title: Muhurat trading 2025: Nifty50 closes above 25,800; Sensex up nearly 63 points
description: Stock market today on Muhurat trading 2025: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green for the one-hour special Diwali Muhurat trading session on Tuesday.

title: Delhi air pollution worsens: Tracking city’s AQI over 10 Diwalis; this year is just as toxic
description: Delhi residents woke to thick grey haze as air quality turned 'very poor' post-Diwali. Many burst firecrackers beyond the Supreme Court's limit. Pollution levels reached 'severe' in several areas. This follows a trend of poor air quality after Diwali celebrations in previous years, highlighting the impact of fireworks on existing pollution.

title: AI hiring: Startups rent luxury flats in San Francisco; Analysts ‘never seen anything like it’
description: AI startups in San Francisco are leasing luxury apartments for employees to combat the city's competitive housing market and attract top talent. This strategy goes beyond higher salaries, with some companies also offering rent stipends to encourage proximity to the office. The AI boom has significantly inflated rents, prompting these innovative housing solutions.

title: Why Rizwan was removed as Pakistan captain - shocking inside details
description: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Mohammad Rizwan has been removed as ODI captain, replaced by Shaheen Shah Afridi. Sources told TimesofIndia.com that Rizwan’s refusal to promote betting companies led to his ouster, despite his strong performances. Former captain Rashid Latif slammed the PCB, hinting at ideological bias, as Shaheen prepares to lead Pakistan against South Africa in Faisalabad.

title: IMD warns of heavy rain, thunderstorms & flood risk across several states
description: Southern and eastern India are bracing for a week of intense rainfall and thunderstorms, with the IMD predicting widespread showers and heavy downpours through October 26. Northeast monsoon activity is surging, prompting flash flood warnings for several districts in Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh. Residents are urged to exercise caution.

title: AWS outage impact: McDonald’s, Microsoft, Apple Music, Alexa hit
description: A significant AWS outage on Monday, October 20, disrupted services for major companies like McDonald's, Microsoft Office 365, and Apple Music. The disruption stemmed from DNS issues affecting Amazon's DynamoDB database, impacting over 70 AWS services and highlighting cloud infrastructure fragility. Recovery efforts began in the afternoon, with services gradually returning online.

title: ‘Purification’ over namaz at Shaniwarwada: ASI officer files plaint against 3 women; NCP seeks action
description: BJP MP Medha Kulkarni faced strong criticism from NCP and Shiv Sena for protesting and 'purifying' Shaniwarwada after Muslim women offered namaz. The NCP demanded a police case against her, alleging she disturbed communal harmony. The incident led to police deployment at the historic site.

title: Fight erupts in Texans vs Seahawks as Stingley Jr. knocks off Smith-Njigba’s helmet
description: Tempers flared between the Texans and Seahawks as Derek Stingley Jr. was flagged for unnecessary roughness after knocking Jaxon Smith-Njigba's helmet off following an interception. The penalty shifted momentum, impacting the Texans' drive. This intense moment highlighted the high stakes and discipline challenges in a pivotal Week 7 matchup.

title: Hardik Pandya-Mahieka Sharma make it official? Diwali celebration wins the internet
description: Indian cricketer Hardik Pandya and model Mahieka Sharma have confirmed their relationship, appearing together at a Diwali celebration in coordinated red outfits. This public outing follows recent glimpses of their beach birthday getaway and airport sightings, putting an end to months of speculation about their romance.

title: Top picks for Samvat 2082: Muhurat trading today – 10 stocks for up to 38% returns
description: As India enters Samvat 2082, Motilal Oswal Financial Services analysts highlight a strong growth phase for Nifty earnings, projecting an 8% rise in FY26 and 16% in FY27. Muhurat Trading 2025 could signal market recovery, with the brokerage listing top stock picks like SBI, M&M, and BEL for potential gains up to 38%.

title: 'Only Congress will respect Nitish’: Pappu Yadav accuses BJP of isolating CM
description: Congress MP Pappu Yadav claims the BJP-led NDA is sidelining Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. He stated that only the Congress party will offer Kumar the respect he deserves. Yadav believes Kumar will not remain with the NDA after the upcoming Bihar elections. Bihar is scheduled to vote in November.

title: 'Adopt swadeshi, respect all languages': PM Modi’s letter to nation on Diwali; highlights achievements
description: Prime Minister Modi celebrated Deepavali, linking it to national progress and Lord Ram's ideals of justice. He highlighted the eradication of Naxalism in several districts and praised economic reforms like the GST Savings Festival. PM Modi emphasized India's rising global influence and urged citizens towards self-reliance and unity, inspired by the festival's spirit of shared light.

title: Bengaluru techie suicide scandal deepens: Ola Electric CEO booked; kin cite mysterious fund transfer
description: Ola Electric faces abetment to suicide charges after an engineer's death. His family alleges workplace humiliation and salary denial drove him to suicide, naming CEO Bhavish Aggarwal and a senior executive in an FIR. The company denies harassment claims, expressing condolences and pledging cooperation with the investigation.

title: Asrani's funeral: 'It was 'Sholay' star's wish to keep his last rites private'
description: Veteran actor and comedian Asrani ji has passed away, with his family honoring his wish for a private funeral. His last social media post was a Diwali greeting to fans. Asrani's family issued a statement mourning his irreparable loss to Hindi cinema and their hearts.

title: Japan gets new PM: Sanae Takaichi becomes first woman to hold top post
description: Sanae Takaichi made history as Japan's first female prime minister, securing victory in a parliamentary vote. Her election, following a coalition agreement, ends a political deadlock and is expected to bring stability. Takaichi, a conservative figure, is anticipated to pursue policies similar to former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

title: Orionid meteor shower peaks over US tonight: When and where to catch the blazing trails
description: Stargazers across the US are in for a treat as the Orionid meteor shower peaks tonight, offering up to 20 shooting stars hourly. Best viewed after midnight until dawn, this celestial spectacle is caused by debris from Halley's Comet.

title: Explained: $100K H-1B fee exempt for F-1 students; how to switch status
description: A new $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications will impact new foreign applicants from September 21, 2025. USCIS confirms F-1 students in the United States are exempt when changing status. This allows international graduates to transition to professional roles without the significant cost. The fee targets overseas hires, not those already integrated into the US workforce.

title: Muhurat Trading 2025: Top stocks to buy in Samvat 2082 for up to 30% returns
description: As India celebrates Samvat 2082, LKP Securities unveils its top stock picks for Muhurat Trading, anticipating up to 30% gains. The brokerage highlights Bajaj Finance, Divi's Laboratories, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, Swiggy, State Bank of India, and SBI Cards, citing strong technical indicators and bullish chart patterns for these selections.

title: Rohit Sharma loses temper, yells at Shubman Gill - watch
description: New Indian captain Shubman Gill and Rohit Sharma struggled in the first ODI against Australia, with both openers dismissed early. A viral video resurfaced showing Rohit's frustration with Gill during a run-out mix-up in a previous match, highlighting the need for better coordination ahead of the crucial second ODI.

title: 'The contribution is not ... ': Ravi Shastri's comment on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli
description: Ravi Shastri believes Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's immense contributions over a decade will ensure their legacies remain intact, regardless of when they retire. The legendary duo recently returned to international cricket after stepping away from Tests and T20Is, but both had a quiet outing in their first ODI against Australia in Perth.

title: Scientists are still puzzled by sudden lights appearing on the Moon
description: For centuries, astronomers have observed Transient Lunar Phenomena (TLPs) – strange lights on the Moon. These enigmatic flashes and glows, possibly caused by meteoroid impacts or gas releases from the lunar interior, offer crucial insights into the Moon's geology and dynamic processes. Ongoing research aims to unravel their mysteries and enhance our understanding of Earth's closest celestial neighbor.

title: 'Eternal truth that good will always triumph': Trump wishes Americans on Diwali
description: President Donald Trump extended Diwali greetings, emphasizing its message of light over darkness and unity. He highlighted the festival as a time for families and friends to celebrate community, hope, and renewal. The observance is gaining official recognition across the US, with several states incorporating it into school calendars or as holidays.

title: Trouble in paradise! Sehwag's Diwali social post creates a stir: 'Where is...?'
description: Virender Sehwag's recent Diwali post featuring only his sons has sparked speculation about his marriage. Fans are questioning the absence of his wife, Aarti Sehwag, amidst reports of their separation after 20 years. The couple has remained silent on the rumors, while Sehwag's sons also appeared in Aarti's separate social media posts.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are prices headed in the near term?
description: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are expected to be volatile, with analysts advising investors to buy on dips rather than chase the rally. Despite easing trade tensions and bank concerns, gold saw a sharp rise, driven by ETF inflows and anticipation of Fed rate cuts. Silver also experienced a significant rally, with a similar 'buy the dip' strategy recommended.

title: Delhi air quality turns ‘Severe’ post-Diwali: Key precautions for residents & travelers
description: Delhi choked on severe smog post-Diwali, with the AQI soaring to 451 despite Supreme Court restrictions on firecrackers. Satellite towns also reported hazardous levels. Experts warn of extreme health risks, especially for vulnerable groups. Weather conditions are expected to prolong the smog, urging residents and travelers to take precautions.

title: How routine eye exams help detect cardiovascular problems early
description: Routine eye exams are now revealing early signs of heart disease. The retina's delicate blood vessels can show changes like narrowed vessels or 'eye strokes,' indicating potential cardiovascular risks. This non-invasive approach allows for earlier detection of conditions like high blood pressure and atherosclerosis, prompting crucial follow-up with doctors and potentially preventing serious heart events.

title: Trump's warning to China; seeks ‘fair deal’ amid tariff row
description: President Trump expressed optimism for a fair trade deal with China, despite his trade official accusing Beijing of "economic coercion." Trump highlighted his strong relationship with President Xi and upcoming meetings, while also warning of significant trouble for China if trade falters. The US also signed a critical minerals agreement with Australia to counter China's regional influence.

title: Spent Rs 66k, Pune farmer gets Rs 664 for 7.5 quintals of rain-hit onions
$100,000 H-1B visa fee: Who pays, who doesn’t? Trump admin clears the air amid confusion over policy
description: USCIS has detailed its $100,000 visa fee, requiring payment via a new portal for applicants to proceed. Notably, existing visa holders like F-1 students and L-1 professionals are exempt from this surcharge when changing status to H-1B. Exceptions are extremely rare, requiring Homeland Security's discretion for national interest cases.

title: Are BSE and NSE open for trading today? Check Muhurat trading details
description: Indian stock markets are set for a special Muhurat Trading session on Tuesday, October 21, 2025. This one-hour trading window marks the start of Samvat 2082, symbolizing prosperity. The National Stock Exchange and Bombay Stock Exchange will be closed for Diwali Laxmi Pujan on October 21 and Balipratipada on October 22.

title: 'Sholay' actor Asrani passes away: PM Modi remembers him as 'a gifted entertainer'
description: Veteran actor Asrani has passed away at 84. He died after a long illness. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah have paid tribute. Asrani entertained millions with his performances. His family performed his last rites. He is survived by his wife, sister, and nephew. His legacy will be cherished.

title: Watch: Nakamura breaks down while talking about Naroditsky; American GM passes away
description: The chess world mourns Grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky's sudden death at 29. Naroditsky was a celebrated player and educator. He earned his Grandmaster title at 17. He was a top player in classical, rapid, and blitz chess. Naroditsky also built a large online following. His passing is a significant loss for competitive and online chess.

title: Diwali bank holidays 2025: When will banks be closed? Check state-wise schedule
description: Diwali celebrations in October 2025 will bring several bank holidays across India. Different states will observe closures on various days for festivals like Naraka Chaturdashi, Laxmi Puja, Govardhan Puja, and Bhai Dooj. Some regions will experience extended breaks. Customers can use digital banking services during these periods. Planning transactions in advance is recommended.

title: 'Don't argue': Virat Kohli receives a tough message after Perth duck
description: Former Australian cricketer Matthew Hayden advised Virat Kohli to avoid overthinking and self-arguments after a duck in the first ODI against Australia. Hayden expressed faith in Kohli's exceptional technique and experience, emphasizing his destructive potential with clarity. India pacer Arshdeep Singh also defended Kohli, calling form a mere word for the seasoned batter.

title: Watch: Bulldozers move in as part of White House razed; Trump set to build grand ballroom
description: Construction has begun on President Trump's new 90,000-square-foot ballroom, involving the demolition of the East Wing of the White House. This significant renovation, one of the largest in decades, aims to nearly double the building's size. The project, funded in part by corporate executives, has raised ethics concerns regarding donor access.

title: ‘Never trust an Indian’: Racist, pro-Nazi chat by Trump nominee leaked
description: Leaked chats reveal Paul Ingrassia, Trump's nominee for Special Counsel, made deeply offensive remarks. He disparaged MLK Jr. Day, used racial slurs, and admitted to a "Nazi streak." Ingrassia also expressed views on race and leadership that drew sharp criticism from chat participants, sparking serious debate.

title: Mohsin Naqvi plays musical chairs: Third Pakistan captaincy change in 12 months
description: Shaheen Shah Afridi has been appointed Pakistan's new ODI captain for the upcoming series against South Africa, marking the third leadership change in the format within a year. He takes over from Mohammad Rizwan, who led the team to several series wins before facing challenges in 2025, including a significant defeat in the West Indies.

title: 'I don’t like you and never will': Trump’s confrontation with Australian ambassador
description: President Trump had an awkward exchange with Australian Ambassador Kevin Rudd during a press conference, seemingly unaware of Rudd's presence and past criticisms. This encounter highlights existing tensions between the two officials, despite Prime Minister Albanese's efforts to strengthen US-Australia ties and secure cooperation on critical minerals.
